Name: Stela of a Farewell Scene Placed Over Funerary Niche
Description: The funerary stela, an upright stone with a sculpted surface, was carved in limestone and has a relief depicting a farewell scene. Ptolemaios Demeter, the deceased, sits on a chair with his leg on a stool. His wife stands before him as he takes farewell of her. Stelae such as this were used as slabs to seal the openings of the rock-cut loculi, or niches, which contained corpses that were placed horizontally. The loculi were densely placed next to and above each other.
